availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Lanigan (Bricklayer and 1st serg. 1st Ky. L. A.)

body.p: U.S. Army soldier and bricklayer. Native of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Bricklayer in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and first sergeant from October 6, 1863. Reported as deserted from Somerset, Kentucky, on April 12, 1864.

ab.bibl: Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0149, 0507.
